p: Most studies aimed at preparing a universal M2e-based influenza vaccine have used the whole M2 ectodomain (a.a. 2–24). However, truncated forms of M2e (Table 1) can be used to induce an immune response to important areas of M2e, reduce the cost of vaccine production and allow the use of new vectors that have a small capacity. For example, there are a number of antibodies (14C2, 3F12, 8C6, 1B12, Z3G1) [ 30, 78, 140] that recognize only a fraction of the total M2e, and that find wide application in practice.
